cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who played adaline in the age of adaline
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
To answer the question, I need to recall the film "The Age of Adaline," which was released in 2015. The movie centers around a woman named Adaline Bowman, who stops aging after a freak accident. The lead role of Adaline is played by an actress who is known for her work in various films. I will think about the cast of the movie and identify the actress who portrayed Adaline.

Answer:
Blake Lively played Adaline in "The Age of Adaline."

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who played adaline in the age of adaline
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['The Age of Adaline is a 2015 American romantic fantasy film directed by Lee Toland Krieger and written by J. Mills Goodloe and Salvador Paskowitz. The film stars Blake Lively in the title role, with Michiel Huisman, Kathy Baker, Amanda Crew, Harrison Ford, and Ellen Burstyn in supporting roles. Narrated by Hugh Ross, the story follows Adaline Bowman, a young woman who stops aging after an accident at the age of 29.\n', 'On April 24, 2015, Lionsgate released "The Age of Adaline", an original Goodloe and Salvador Paskowitz screenplay, starring Blake Lively, Harrison Ford and Michiel Huisman.\n', 'He directed "The Age of Adaline", starring Blake Lively and Michiel Huisman. Production started in March 2014, and the film was released in April 2015.\n', 'Lively starred in the film "The Age of Adaline" (2015), opposite Michiel Huisman and Harrison Ford, playing a woman who "stops aging after recovering from a near-fatal accident." The film was a modest commercial success, grossing $65.7\xa0million from a production budget of $25\xa0million.\n', 'BULLET::::- "The Age of Adaline" (2015) - executive producer\n', 'On May 12, 2010 it was announced that "The Age of Adaline" would be co-financed and co-produced by Lakeshore Entertainment and Sidney Kimmel Entertainment. Salvador Paskowitz and J. Mills Goodloe wrote the script. Sierra / Affinity has the international rights, while producers were Steve Golin, Alix Madigan, Tom Rosenberg and Gary Lucchesi. On July 20, 2010 it was reported that Andy Tennant was set to direct the film. On October 31, 2010, Summit Entertainment bought the US distribution rights to the film, which was set to begin shooting in March 2011 for an early 2012 release.\n', '"The Age of Adaline" premiered in New York City on April 19, 2015 was theatrically released on April 24 in the United States by Lionsgate. The film received mixed reviews from critics, with many praising the performances of Lively and Ford respectively and was frequently cited as some of their best work in recent years. It was a modest box-office success, grossing $65.7 million worldwide on a $25 million budget. The film received two nominations at the 42nd Saturn Awards, one for Best Fantasy Film and one for Lively for Best Actress.\n', 'In 2014, to commemorate the twentieth anniversary of the strip, Adam retook Aline\'s character at age forty, now with age-related problems and a daughter, Luna, but "with more polyamory than ever".\n', 'On February 22, 2011, it was reported that Gabriele Muccino was in talks to direct the film, replacing Tennant, with the film re-titled from "The Age of Adaline" to simply "Adaline". On May 14, 2012, it was announced that Spanish director Isabel Coixet would direct the film instead. On October 16, 2013, Lee Toland Krieger was reported to be the actual director of the film. Producer Dan Cohen had shown him the script at a general meeting in 2009.\n', 'The poem was quoted in the elevator in the 2015 film "The Age of Adaline", when Ellis first met Adaline. \n']

2. **Title Role**: The passages explicitly state that Blake Lively stars in the title role of Adaline Bowman. This is the direct answer to the question, as it identifies the actress who played the main character.

4. **Supporting Cast**: The film features notable actors such as Michiel Huisman, Kathy Baker, Amanda Crew, Harrison Ford, and Ellen Burstyn. While not directly related to the question, this information enhances understanding of the film's overall cast and may indicate the film's production quality and appeal.

5. **Reception and Success**: The film is noted to have received mixed reviews but was a modest commercial success, grossing $65.7 million against a $25 million budget. This context can help frame the significance of Lively's performance within the film's reception.

6. **Awards and Nominations**: The film received two nominations at the 42nd Saturn Awards, one of which was for Lively as Best Actress. This highlights the recognition of her performance and adds to her credibility as an actress in this role.

question_info.question: who played adaline in the age of adaline
passages:
The Age of Adaline is a 2015 American romantic fantasy film directed by Lee Toland Krieger and written by J. Mills Goodloe and Salvador Paskowitz. The film stars Blake Lively in the title role, with Michiel Huisman, Kathy Baker, Amanda Crew, Harrison Ford, and Ellen Burstyn in supporting roles. Narrated by Hugh Ross, the story follows Adaline Bowman, a young woman who stops aging after an accident at the age of 29.
On April 24, 2015, Lionsgate released "The Age of Adaline", an original Goodloe and Salvador Paskowitz screenplay, starring Blake Lively, Harrison Ford and Michiel Huisman.
He directed "The Age of Adaline", starring Blake Lively and Michiel Huisman. Production started in March 2014, and the film was released in April 2015.
Lively starred in the film "The Age of Adaline" (2015), opposite Michiel Huisman and Harrison Ford, playing a woman who "stops aging after recovering from a near-fatal accident." The film was a modest commercial success, grossing $65.7 million from a production budget of $25 million.
BULLET::::- "The Age of Adaline" (2015) - executive producer
On May 12, 2010 it was announced that "The Age of Adaline" would be co-financed and co-produced by Lakeshore Entertainment and Sidney Kimmel Entertainment. Salvador Paskowitz and J. Mills Goodloe wrote the script. Sierra / Affinity has the international rights, while producers were Steve Golin, Alix Madigan, Tom Rosenberg and Gary Lucchesi. On July 20, 2010 it was reported that Andy Tennant was set to direct the film. On October 31, 2010, Summit Entertainment bought the US distribution rights to the film, which was set to begin shooting in March 2011 for an early 2012 release.
"The Age of Adaline" premiered in New York City on April 19, 2015 was theatrically released on April 24 in the United States by Lionsgate. The film received mixed reviews from critics, with many praising the performances of Lively and Ford respectively and was frequently cited as some of their best work in recent years. It was a modest box-office success, grossing $65.7 million worldwide on a $25 million budget. The film received two nominations at the 42nd Saturn Awards, one for Best Fantasy Film and one for Lively for Best Actress.
In 2014, to commemorate the twentieth anniversary of the strip, Adam retook Aline's character at age forty, now with age-related problems and a daughter, Luna, but "with more polyamory than ever".
On February 22, 2011, it was reported that Gabriele Muccino was in talks to direct the film, replacing Tennant, with the film re-titled from "The Age of Adaline" to simply "Adaline". On May 14, 2012, it was announced that Spanish director Isabel Coixet would direct the film instead. On October 16, 2013, Lee Toland Krieger was reported to be the actual director of the film. Producer Dan Cohen had shown him the script at a general meeting in 2009.
The poem was quoted in the elevator in the 2015 film "The Age of Adaline", when Ellis first met Adaline.
